intro: Cylindrolobus brachystachyus, commonly known as the short-stalked cylindrolobus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to Mediterranean climates. The plant is characterized by its narrow, cylindrical leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
